channel.title: Cybersecurity on 无关紧要的宇宙
channel.description: Recent content in Cybersecurity on 无关紧要的宇宙

item.title: A Premium Luggage Service's Web Bugs Exposed the Travel Plans of Every User—Including Diplomats
item.description: Security flaws in Airportr, a door-to-door luggage checking service used by 10 airlines, let hackers access user data and even gain privileges that would have let them redirect or steal luggage.

item.title: A Premium Luggage Service's Web Bugs Exposed the Travel Plans of Every User—Including Diplomats
item.description: Security flaws in Airportr, a door-to-door luggage checking service used by 10 airlines, let hackers access user data and even gain privileges that would have let them redirect or steal luggage.

item.title: Microsoft Put Older Versions of SharePoint on Life Support. Hackers Are Taking Advantage
item.description: Multiple hacking groups—including state actors from China—have targeted a vulnerability in older, on-premises versions of the file-sharing tool after a flawed attempt to patch it.

item.title: Microsoft Put Older Versions of SharePoint on Life Support. Hackers Are Taking Advantage
item.description: Multiple hacking groups—including state actors from China—have targeted a vulnerability in older, on-premises versions of the file-sharing tool after a flawed attempt to patch it.

item.title: China’s Salt Typhoon Hackers Breached the US National Guard for Nearly a Year
item.description: Plus: Secret IRS data-sharing with ICE, a 20-year-old hackable vulnerability in train brakes, and more.

item.title: China’s Salt Typhoon Hackers Breached the US National Guard for Nearly a Year
item.description: Plus: Secret IRS data-sharing with ICE, a 20-year-old hackable vulnerability in train brakes, and more.

item.title: How China’s Patriotic ‘Honkers’ Became the Nation’s Elite Cyberspies
item.description: A new report traces the history of the early wave of Chinese hackers who became the backbone of the state’s espionage apparatus.

item.title: How China’s Patriotic ‘Honkers’ Became the Nation’s Elite Cyberspies
item.description: A new report traces the history of the early wave of Chinese hackers who became the backbone of the state’s espionage apparatus.

item.title: Hackers Are Finding New Ways to Hide Malware in DNS Records
item.description: Newly published research shows that the domain name system—a fundamental part of the web—can be exploited to hide malicious code and prompt injection attacks against chatbots.

item.title: Hackers Are Finding New Ways to Hide Malware in DNS Records
item.description: Newly published research shows that the domain name system—a fundamental part of the web—can be exploited to hide malicious code and prompt injection attacks against chatbots.

item.title: Adoption Agency Data Exposure Revealed Information About Children and Parents
item.description: A trove of 1.1 million records left accessible on the open web shows how much sensitive information can be created—and made vulnerable—during the adoption process.

item.title: Adoption Agency Data Exposure Revealed Information About Children and Parents
item.description: A trove of 1.1 million records left accessible on the open web shows how much sensitive information can be created—and made vulnerable—during the adoption process.
